thread.title: 5 best smartphones you can buy under Rs 10,000
thread.title_full: 5 best smartphones you can buy under Rs 10,000

title: 5 best smartphones you can buy under Rs 10,000
text: 5 best smartphones you can buy under Rs 10,000 TNN/ Ashutosh Desai/September 14,2015 1 /6 The sub-Rs 10,000 Android smartphone market has become so saturated in the last one year that it has become difficult to keep track of the best models in the segment. To help you find the best budget smartphone for you, we have compiled the best models you can buy in this price range, depending on what you need the handset for: Productivity, social networking, casual gaming or photography. So, here's our list of the five best smartphones you can buy under Rs 10,000. Micromax Canvas Xpress 2 -- Rs 5,999 Budget warrior Micromax Canvas Xpress 2's main limitation is 8GB of internal storage; however, it is extendable with the microSD slot and USB OTG support. * 5-inch HD (1280x720px) IPS display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 * 1.4GHz Mediatek MTK6592M octa-core processor, 1GB RAM * 8GB internal storage, microSD card (up to 32GB) and USB OTG support * 13MP rear camera with dual-LED flash, 2MP front camera * Dual-sim functionality, 3G support Xiaomi Redmi 2 Prime -- Rs 6,999 Alternatively, for greater internal storage and memory, you could opt for Xiaomi Redmi 2 Prime. * 4.7-inch HD (1280x720px) IPS display * 1.2GHz Snapdragon 410 quad-core processor, 2GB RAM * 16GB internal storage, microSD card support up to 32GB * 8MP rear camera with LED flash, 2MP front camera * Dual-sim functionality, 4G support * Android 4.4.4 (KitKat) Asus Zenfone 2 Laser-- Rs 9,999 Asus Zenfone 2 Laser's rear camera is capable of capturing sharp pictures with great detail and you get pre-loaded apps for making collages and slideshows. * 5.5-inch HD (1280x720px) IPS display with Gorilla Glass 4 * 1.2GHz Snapdragon 410 quad-core processor, 2GB RAM * 16GB internal storage, microSD card support up to 32GB * 13MP rear camera with dual-LED flash, 5MP front camera * Dual-sim functionality, 4G support * Android 5.0 (Lollipop) Lenovo K3 Note -- Rs 9,999 Lenovo K3 Note ticks all the right boxes when it comes to its internal hardware that's capable of playing 3D games like Asphalt 8 and FIFA 15, but its display is not scratch-resistant and the cameras do not perform well in low-light situations. Key features: * 5.5-inch Full HD (1920x1080px) display * 1.7GHz MediaTek MT6752 octa-core processor, 2GB RAM * 13MP rear camera (with dual LED flash), 5MP front camera * Dual-sim functionality, 4G support * 16GB internal storage, microSD card (up to 32GB) and USB OTG support * 2900mAh battery * Android 5.0 (Lollipop) operating system Micromax YU Yureka Plus -- Rs 8,999 Alternatively, you can consider YU's Yureka Plus, which smartphone runs Cyanogen, a modified version of Android minus bloatware. While it is second only to Lenovo K3 Note in processing muscle, it provides users with more controls for customization: You can manage app permissions, block phone numbers, and more. Additionally, its cameras capture sharp photographs with good detail. * 5.5-inch Full HD (1920x1080px) IPS display with Gorilla Glass 3 * 1.5GHz Snapdragon 615 octa-core processor, 2GB RAM * 16GB internal storage, microSD card support up to 32GB * 13MP rear camera with LED flash, 5MP front camera * Dual-sim functionality, 4G support
